title: Aging and Memory Decline
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Aging and Memory Decline.

hook.text: Your grandmother remembers 1962 perfectly but can't recall what she ate for lunch.

buildup.text: With aging, episodic memory and processing speed decline. But vocabulary and world knowledge don't.

discovery.text: The hippocampus shrinks about 1â€“2% per year after 60, making new memory formation harder.

twist.text: But the decline isn't uniform. Mentally and socially active elders decline far more slowly.

climax.text: Learning new things, staying social, and exercising all protect the aging brain.

punchline.text: Age slows memory. Activity fights back.
